common late reading 𓇋 ⋍ j :

Syllable bá PA 𒉺 = 𒁁𒋻 páttar feather

𓇋 feather 𒁁𒋻 páttar 𒈦𒋫𒌋𒉿𒅈 pártauwar πτέρυξ ptérux ფრთა prta pʰrtʰɑ पक्ष pakṣá phak per
𓇋 rapra pepó 𓇋𓇋 fur бол foil
𓇋 feather ფრთა prta 𓆃 पंख paṅkh bang3/bang4/pang1/pang2 膀 bǎng wing 𓆃

Exceptions:
iVory 𓇋𓃀𓎛𓄑𓏤 i+F(oot)+Hair+𓄑𓏤
ὑποτρέχ 𓇋𓃀𓅱𓉐 (shelter)
ignorant ⋍ 𓇋𓐍𓅓𓅪 ⇔ fake / 非 fēi 𓇋𓇋 faila falsch fehl 乏 fá faux

Keep in mind that these are modern cognates of an extinct language. Even though the route is undeniable the extra rendering can vary quite significantly: See 𓇋𓎛𓃾 above

𓇋 𓀁 EY! whey why hey wei 喂 pheme! say yuē 曰 ?

𓆄 Shu ⇔ FeaShur 𓆅𓆄 βeta 𓇋Feather ⲃⲏⲛⲓ , ⲃⲉⲛⲓ phoenix
*péth₂r̥ JA *peth₂- “to fly”.
Feder Vieh gefiedert
ⲙⲉϩⲓ epHi[der] m. feather, lancet
shpend “bird”,penna, թիռ tʿiṙ

In Linear B, there is a small ligature for male: π (phallus?)
In Egyptian the feather viper has a similar 'v' on its head: 𓆑
A similar ligature turnes 𓆄Shu into 𓆅Fea together 𓆅𓆄FeaShur feather.
phoenix ⋍ 𓅥 benhuron 𓅣 notice "ph" ligature

Once the 𓇋 > Feder root is well established and accepted, one can even go a half a step further:
𓇋 > gh as in enough, as in 𓇋 Gefieder, as in 𓅦 = 𓈖𓇋𓏲𓂢𓅭 > nagħma > nȍj noj 鸟 niǎo

𓇋 𓃀 ⋍ पि ƒ
𓇋 𓃀 𓏏 𓃙 | thirst | پیاس pyās प्यास pyās

GFTR PTR wildcard fallacy 𒀀 water

𓇋 𓏏 𓎛 𓀜 | draw | 𐌰𐍆𐍄𐌹𐌿𐌷𐌰𐌽 aƒtιuḫen 𓇋𓏏𓎛𓀜 abziehen

𓇋 ≈ ⲟⲉⲓ ⲁⲉⲓ ⲱⲓ ⲁⲓ in 𓇋𓊪𓏏𓌽 jpt ⲟⲉⲓⲡⲉ /ˈɔj.pə/ Sahidic 𓇋𓊪𓏏𓌽 jpt ⲁⲉⲓⲡⲉ /ˈaj.pə/ Akhmimic 𓇋𓊪𓏏𓌽 jpt ⲱⲓⲡⲓ /ˈoj.pi/ Bohairic 𓇋𓊪𓏏𓌽 jpt ⲁⲓⲡⲓ /ˈaj.pi/ Fayyumic 𓇋𓊪𓇌𓏏𓌽 jpyt
